lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/JooBot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run JooBot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a date/time value that may either be a valid {@link LocalDateTime}
* or a raw string if parsing fails.
* This class encapsulates the logic of parsing dates provided in the format
* d/M/yyyy HHmm, and formatting them for display and file storage.
* Constructs a {@code DateTimeValue} from the given input string.
* If the input matches the expected date-time format {@code d/M/yyyy HHmm},
* it is stored as a {@link LocalDateTime}. Otherwise, it is stored as a raw string.
* @param input the user provided string, which may or may not be a date
* Returns the value in a user-friendly display format.
* - If the input was a valid date, it will be formatted as {@code dd MMM yyyy HHmm}.
* - Otherwise, the raw input string is returned.
* Returns the value in a file storage format.
* - If the input was a valid date, it will be formatted as {@code d/M/yyyy HHmm}.
* - Otherwise, the raw input string is returned.
* @return the formatted string for file saving
* Represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView and text.

* The main class for running the JooBot application.
* JooBot is a simple task chatbot that supports commands such as
* adding tasks, marking them as done, deleting them, and persisting them
* Creates a JooBot instance with the given file path for storage.
* @param filePath the file path where tasks are stored

* Provides different types of errors with user-friendly messages.

* @param type the type of error that occurred
* Returns the type of error for this exception.
* @return the {@link ErrorType} associated with this exception
* Maps each {@link ErrorType} to a corresponding human-readable error message.
Error! Empty input is not allowed.
Type one of these as inputs:
You have an empty to do list!""";
Please enter an index that is of valid range.""";
Please enter a description of the task.""";
The deadline must have a /by <text> OR /by <D/M/YYYY HHMM>.""";
The deadline must have a /from <text> OR /from <D/M/YYYY HHMM> and"""
Type one of these as inputs:
default -> "This is a different error."; // should not reach this stage
